lines.text:
[joking to friends]
Go on, wash your necks!

[advising her daughter-in-law at her wedding reception]
Do not permit yourself to get fat. Fat has ruined more marriages than actresses and pretty widows.
The herring will run, Germans or no Germans.
A dry punch bowl is against nature.

[watching a Nazi bookburning]
I'm writing a novel myself. I'd be very disappointed if you gentlemen don't burn it.

[about the Nazis]
They steal blankets, pots, pans, food, everything! They kidnap your husband! A great nation? Conquerors? THEIVES - that's what they are! They ought to be handled in a police court!
Finally, Mrs. Bergesen, a police court will be set up and the traffic will be enormous.
...I've lived a quiet life. The Germans have not lived quiet lives. We must learn from them how to become gangsters, thugs, useful with knife, dynamite, poison!
Bergesen was right. Nobody, no civilized human being can know how bad they are!
You know, Harper's decent, but being an intelligence officer destroys all faith in human nature.
It's hard for me to talk. Our people, as you know, are not demonstrative, but we don't forget our friends nor our enemies.
No one s going to get victory as a gift, Anna. We will get only what we earn.
